name: Famous Car Crashes Quiz | Celebrities Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Jayne Mansfield was killed in a car accident. Which of these is true?
options: Mansfield was the driver of the car
questions.explanation:
Neither statement is true.

	Mansfield was one of three adults in the car; all three died instantly in the accident.  Three of her five children were in the back; they survived the crash.

questions.text: Which of these famous writers died in a car accident?
questions.explanation:
Albert Camus.

	Hemingway died by suicide, Fitzgerald more-or-less drank himself to death, Wolfe died of pneumonia.

questions.text: Montgomery Clift almost died in a car accident while he was driving away from a Hollywood party. Who was throwing the party?
questions.explanation:
Elizabeth Taylor.

	Taylor's speedy intervention may have saved Clift's life.

questions.text: Which statement is true of the traffic death of Margaret Mitchell?
options: She was driving without a license
questions.explanation:
She was a pedestrian.

	The author of "Gone With The Wind" was on foot when she was nailed by a taxicab.

questions.text: Jan Berry (of "Jan and Dean" fame) died in early 2004. His car accident several decades earlier had serious impact on his health for the rest of his life. Where did that accident occur?
questions.explanation:
California.

	"You can't come back from Deadman's Curve" according to the song. The song was right.

questions.text: James Dean died young when he was involved in a fatal car accident. Shortly before the accident he had filmed a "safe driving" ad with which actor?
questions.explanation:
Gig Young.

	No one could have guessed that the star of "Rebel Without A Cause" would die so soon thereafter.

questions.text: Princess Grace, the former Grace Kelly, was able to work in her future husband's "back yard" during the filming of this movie.
questions.explanation:
To Catch a Thief.

	The movie was set on the French Riviera - only a "stone's throw" away from Prince Rainier and Monaco.

questions.text: Which of the following was killed in a car accident?
questions.explanation:
None of these.

	Stevens died as a result of a drug overdose: it may or may not have been an accident. Niven died at an early age as a result of a fall; her husband (who was left with two small children) was devastated. Lombarde died in a plane crash.

questions.text: Ted Kennedy was injured (and Mary Jo Kopechne was killed) in the famous accident at Chappaquiddick. When did the accident occur?
questions.explanation:
1969.

	Miraculously, Kennedy's political career survived. (Did this cost him a shot at the presidency?)

questions.text: The most famous car accident of all may be the one that claimed the life of Princess Diana. Where did the accident occur?
questions.explanation:
Paris.

	Everything that could possibly be said has already been said about this tragic incident.
